Description: Star-shaped bead in Egyptian blue. Pierced through thickness. Quite eroded. With two other glazed composition elements (see UC73690 a & c) on modern string: string 1590 in Petrie/Shiah bead corpus.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by The Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Xia type PD55. Xia, N. 2014, Ancient Egyptian Beads, Heidelberg.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QG.24)
